newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish share index hits new all-time closing high.
newsitem.headline: Danish share index hits new all-time closing high.

text.p: The Danish top-20 KFX share index closed on Tuesday at a new all-time closing high for the second consecutive day, boosted by the strong dollar and Wall Street but dealers foresaw profit-taking ahead and modest falls in the days ahead.
"The dollar's advance and a bullish U.S. market helped us along today but I scent profit-taking ahead so tomorrow could end in moderate falls," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index gained 1.30 point to reach a new all-time closing high of 131.49, while the KFX December future rose 1.20 point to 131.20 with 615 contracts traded.
Shares which did particularly well on a positive day included Novo Nordisk, Den Danske Bank and Tele Danmark.
Novo Nordisk continued to surge ahead, putting on 30 crowns to end at 1095, while Den Danske Bank rose four to 450.
Tele Danmark was the most traded KFX paper, finishing seven crowns higher at 296 with 266,000 shares changing hands.
Carlsberg closed untraded at 375 after announcing record 1995/96 profits but an uncertain forecast on Monday.
